titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mulvey Family Papers AIA.043
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-11-22 16:24:56 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

change.item: Updated by Megan O'Shea to incorporate banner from accession number 2018.098

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

physdesc.extent: in 1 manuscript box, 1 oversize folder in a shared box, and 1 rolled banner

did.abstract: This collection consists mainly of materials collected by Kathleen Mulvey documenting her family history. The collection includes family correspondence, panoramas of Irish American social organization functions, a banner celebrating John F. Kennedy's trip to Ireland in 1963, and a scrapbook from Elizabeth Mulvey's first trip to Europe in the late 1920s, which included Ireland, Italy, France, and Switzerland. Elizabeth Mulvey was a teacher and later public school principal in the Bronx. Kathleen Mulvey was the first woman president of the Irish Institute and an active member of the County Carlow Society.
did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in English, with one banner in Irish.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Kathleen Mulvey, 1999. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.032.
An additional accession was donated by Kathleen Mulvey in 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.098.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Kathleen Mulvey, the sister-in-law of Elizabeth Mulvey, were transferred to New York University in 1999. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.
Material in the 2018 accretion, which was created in 1963, is in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Archives of Irish America County Societies Collection (AIA 003)
Archives of Irish America United Irish Counties Association Collection (AIA 056)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Mulvey Family Papers; AIA 043; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials collected by Kathleen Mulvey documenting her family history. The collection includes family correspondence, panoramas of Irish American social organization functions, and a scrapbook from Elizabeth Mulvey's first trip to Europe in the late 1920s, which included visits to Ireland, Italy, France, and Switzerland. The collection also contains a banner celebrating John F. Kennedy's visit to Ireland in 1963.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The order in which these materials were sent to the Tamiment Library has been maintained.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Elizabeth Mulvey was born in the Bronx to a family of Irish immigrants: her father was a carpenter born in the Bronx and her mother was born in Wicklow. Mulvey worked as a teacher and later the principal of a public school in the Bronx.
Kathleen Mulvey was the first woman president of the Irish Institute and an active member of the County Carlow Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Material from the 2018 accretion was assessed for conservation treatment and rolled with treated paper to prevent further deterioration.
